intro: Malapoenna doshia, commonly known as the African daisy, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble daisies. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, thriving in full sun and well-drained soils. Its bright yellow to orange flowers bloom throughout the warmer months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Malapoenna doshia is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
